14   | /*******************************************************************
15   | * RINGBUF CREATE AND DELETE FUNCTIONS
16   | ********************************************************************/
17   | 
18   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
19   | Create a circular buffer and initialize it
20   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
21   | /* 20000709 V1.0 */
22   | 
23   | RINGBUF *
24   | ringbuf_create(int size)	 /*+ Size of the ringbuffer to create +*/
25   | {
26   |   RINGBUF *b = NULL;
27   | 
28   |   /*+ Also check the absolute maximum size +*/
29   |   if (size > MAX_RINGBUF_SIZE) {
30   |     perror("maximum ringbuf size would be  exceeded");
31   | 	exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
32   |   }
33   | 
34   |   /*--- Allocate new ringbuffer  ---*/
35   |   b = (RINGBUF *) calloc(1,sizeof(RINGBUF));
36   |   if (!b) {
37   |     perror("No memory to allocate ringbuf ringbuf_init()");
38   |     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
39   |   }
40   | 
41   |   /*--- Allocate memory in the newly created ring buffer  ---*/
42   |   b->buf = (BYTE *) calloc((size_t)size+1,sizeof(BYTE));
43   |   if (!b->buf) {
44   |     perror("No memory in ringbuf_init()");
45   |     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
46   |   }
47   |   b->size = size;	/*--- Store the size  ---*/
48   | 
49   |   /*--- Initialize variables  ---*/
50   |   b->spos = 0;
51   |   b->rpos = 0;
52   |   b->cnt = 0;
53   |   return(b);
54   | }				   
55   | 
56   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
57   | Delete a ringbuffer from mememory (regardless if it is empty or not
58   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
59   | /* 20000709 V1.0 */
60   | 
61   | void
62   | ringbuf_delete(RINGBUF *b)		/*+ Pointer to ringbuffer to delete +*/
63   | {
64   |   /*--- Is there really a buffer defined ?  ---*/
65   |   if (b==NULL){
66   |     perror("trying to delete a non-existing ringbuffer");
67   | 	exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
68   |   }
69   | 
70   |   /*--- Deallocate memory  ---*/
71   |   if (b->buf)
72   |     free(b->buf);
73   |   free(b);
74   | }
75   | 
76   | /*******************************************************************
77   | * RINGBUF INPUT COMMANDS
78   | ********************************************************************/
79   | 
80   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
81   | Put a BYTE in the ringbuffer
82   | 
83   | Returns nothing. Exits when the ringbuffer is full
84   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
85   | /* 200000709 V1.0 */
86   | 
87   | void 
88   | ringbuf_put(RINGBUF *b, 	/*+ Pointer to the buffer +*/
89   |  		    BYTE c) 		/*+ Byte to store in the buffer +*/
90   | {
91   |   #ifdef RINGBUF_DEBUG
92   |   printf("spos=%4d rpos=%4d size=%4d ",b->spos,b->rpos,b->size);
93   |   if (!iscntrl(c))
94   |     printf("%c",c);
95   |   else
96   |     printf(".");
97   |   printf("\n");
98   |   #endif
99   | 
100  |   if (b->spos+1 == b->rpos) {	   	/*--- Is the buffer full ?  */
101  |     perror("ringbuffer full ");	/*--- Yes, signal error  */
102  |   }
103  |   else {							/*--- No,  */				   
104  |     b->buf[b->spos] = c;			/*--- Store character  */
105  | 	b->spos++;						/*--- Increment storage pointer  */
106  | 	if (b->spos >= b->size)			/*--- Are we at the end of the circular buffer ?  */
107  | 	  b->spos = 0;					/*--- Yes, set pointer to start of buffer */
108  | 	b->cnt++;
109  |   }
110  | }
111  | 
112  | 
113  | /*******************************************************************
114  | * RINGBUF OUTPUT COMMANDS
115  | ********************************************************************/
116  | 
117  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
118  | Get a character from the ring buffer
119  | 
120  | Returns the number of characters retrieved (0 or 1)
121  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
122  | /* 200000709 V1.0 */
123  | 
124  | int
125  | ringbuf_get(RINGBUF *b, /*+ Pointer to the ring buffer +*/
126  | 			BYTE *c)	/*+ The retrieved byte has to be stored here +*/
127  | {
128  |   if (b->rpos == b->size)			/*--- Do we have to wrap ?  */
129  |     b->rpos = 0;					/*--- Yes, wrap to start of ringbuf  */
130  |   if (b->rpos == b->spos) {			/*--- Are ther any characters in the buffer ? */
131  |     *c = '\0';						/*--- No, Set character to NIL character  */
132  |    	return(0);						/*--- No events in the queue */
133  |   }	 
134  |   else {							/*--- Yes, there are characters in the buffer  */
135  |     b->rpos++;						/*--- Increment pointer */  
136  | 	*c = b->buf[b->rpos-1];			/*--- Get character from buffer */
137  | 	b->cnt--;
138  | 	return(1);						/*--- 1 character retrieved  */
139  |   }
140  | }			 
141  | 
142  | 
143  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
144  | Get the number of characters actually stored in the ring buffer
145  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
146  | size_t
147  | ringbuf_cnt(RINGBUF *b)	  /*+ pointer to the ringbuffer +*/
148  | /*+ Returns the number of characters stored +*/
149  | {
150  |   return(b->cnt);
151  | }
152  | 
153  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
154  | Look ahead what is the next character in the rinbuffer,
155  | but do not adjust the pointers
156  | 
157  | Returns the number of characters retrieved (0 or 1)
158  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
159  | /* 200000709 V1.0 */
160  | 
161  | int
162  | ringbuf_peek(RINGBUF *b,  /*+ Pointer to the ring buffer +*/
163  | 			BYTE *c)	  /*+ The retrieved byte will be stored here +*/
164  | {
165  |   int rpos = b->rpos;
166  |   int spos = b->spos;
167  |   int size = b->size;
168  | 
169  |   if (rpos == size)					/*--- Do we have to wrap ?  */
170  |     rpos = 0;						/*--- Yes, wrap to start of ringbuf  */
171  |   if (rpos == spos) {				/*--- Are ther any characters in the buffer ? */
172  |     *c = '\0';						/*--- No, Set character to NIL character  */
173  |    	return(0);						/*--- No events in the queue */
174  |   }	 
175  |   else {							/*--- Yes, there are characters in the buffer  */
176  |     rpos++;							/*--- Increment pointer */  
177  | 	*c = b->buf[rpos-1];			/*--- Get character from buffer */
178  | 	return(1);						/*--- 1 character retrieved  */
179  |   }
180  | }
